ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Version numbering: a plan
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I can see dropping the 0_1_x, but the 0_3_0 serves a valuable purpose. Namely, as soon as the release version 0_2_0 is done, but before another dev version

Michael Stack wrote:
> I'm fine w/ the above except the piece where we add labels of heritrix-0_1_x and heritrix-0_3_0 labels to the repository just before and after the heritrix-0_2_0 labeling.  I don't see any point in our having 3 labels for one repository state. Lets only use the heritrix-?.?.? label in the repository when making releases (whether dev or stable).  The updating (and committing) of our software version as maintained in config. files (project.xml) should be sufficent for making the 'pedigree' of what it is that external users are running clear (I'd also suggest no need of the 'cvs' suffix for version numbers -- the 'odd' numbering scheme should be signifier enough that current state is 'development').
> 
> St.Ack

I can see dropping the 0_1_x, but the 0_3_0 serves a valuable purpose.

Namely, as soon as the release version 0_2_0 is done, but before
another dev version number is assigned, there will be code changes,
perhaps significant ones. Builds from that development would
identify, misleadingly, as 0_2_0 until a dev version number is
assigned.

So I'd like to assign that dev number immediately after a stable
release, making it nearly impossible for anything fetched from
CVS to give confusing version info.

Sound OK?

- Gordon
